kodkod.engine
Class Proof

java.lang.Object
  kodkod.engine.Proof

public final class Proof
extends java.lang.Object

Contains a proof of unsatisfiability of a given FOL formula.

specfield:
formula: Formula // the unsatisfiable formula
bounds: Bounds // the bounds with respect to which the formula is unsatisfiable

Method Summary
 java.util.Iterator<int[]> clauses()
          Returns an iterator over the CNF clauses that constitute the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability wirth respect to this.bounds.
 void refine()
          Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability until a fixed point is reached; that is, until the formula's unsatisfiable core cannot be minimized any further.
 void refine(int numOfIterations)
          Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability numOfIterations times or until a fixed point is reached, whichever comes first.
 int size()
          Returns the size of the proof: the number of clauses in this.formula's unsatisfiable core.
 java.util.Set<Node> trackedNodes()
          Returns the set of all descdents of this.formula that did not reduce to a constant value during translation, provided the options with which the solver was invoked specified that variables be tracked
 IntSet variablesFor(Node node)
          Returns the set of CNF variables, identified by integer literals, allocated to the given node during the translation of this.formula.

public java.util.Iterator<int[]> clauses()
Returns an iterator over the CNF clauses that constitute the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability wirth respect to this.bounds.

Returns:
an iterator over this formula's unsatisfiable core.

refine

public void refine()
Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability until a fixed point is reached; that is, until the formula's unsatisfiable core cannot be minimized any further.

Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - -- the options with which the solver was invoked did not specify the use of a core extracting sat solver
effects:
refines this proof until a fixed point is reached.

refine

public void refine(int numOfIterations)
Refines the proof of this.formula's unsatisfiability numOfIterations times or until a fixed point is reached, whichever comes first.

Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - -- the options with which the solver was invoked did not specify the use of a core extracting sat solver
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - numOfIterations < 0
effects:
refines this proof numOfIterations times or until a fixed point is reached, whichever comes first.

variablesFor

public IntSet variablesFor(Node node)
Returns the set of CNF variables, identified by integer literals, allocated to the given node during the translation of this.formula. These may be used to establish a correspondence between the contents of this.formula's unsatisfiable core and its nodes. If no variables were allocated to the given node, an empty set is returned. Note that the returned set will contain only positive integers; the presence of a negative integer in a clause indicates that its corresponding variable is negated in that clause.

Returns:
the set of CNF variables allocated to the given node during the translation of this.formula
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - - the options with which the solver was invoked did not specify that variables be tracked (see Options.setTrackVars(boolean) and Options.trackVars()).
requires:
node in this.trackedNodes()

trackedNodes

public java.util.Set<Node> trackedNodes()
Returns the set of all descdents of this.formula that did not reduce to a constant value during translation, provided the options with which the solver was invoked specified that variables be tracked

Returns:
the set of all descdents of this.formula that did not reduce to a constant value during translation. The returned set tests for containment using reference equality.
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - - the options with which the solver was invoked did not specify that variables be tracked (see Options.setTrackVars(boolean) and Options.trackVars()).
